items.q: Which actor plays Iron Man in the Marvel Cinematic Universe?
items.explanation: He first portrayed Tony Stark in the 2008 film 'Iron Man'.

items.q: The reality TV show 'Keeping Up with the Kardashians' originally premiered on the E! network.
items.explanation: The show ran for 20 seasons on E! before moving to Hulu.

items.q: Taylor Swift's fans are commonly referred to as 'Beliebers'.
items.explanation: Taylor Swift's fans are called 'Swifties'. Justin Bieber's fans are 'Beliebers'.

items.q: What incredibly successful British author wrote the Harry Potter book series?
items.explanation: The series consists of seven main books detailing the magical adventures of the boy wizard.

items.q: Which wildly popular sci-fi franchise prominently features characters fighting with glowing 'lightsabers'?
items.explanation: Lightsabers are the traditional weapon of the Jedi and the Sith.

items.q: What iconic pop star is famously referred to as the 'King of Pop'?
items.explanation: He is recognized as one of the most culturally significant entertainers of the 20th century.

items.q: What massively popular streaming service debuted with the hit original series 'House of Cards' in 2013?
items.explanation: This marked a major shift towards streaming platforms producing their own high-budget prestige television.

items.q: What is the name of the fictional continent where the majority of the popular series 'Game of Thrones' takes place?
items.explanation: Westeros is the setting for the Seven Kingdoms and the struggle for the Iron Throne.

items.q: Which pop singer released the hit albums '1989' and 'Folklore'?
items.explanation: Taylor Swift released both '1989' (a pop album) and 'Folklore' (an indie folk album).

items.q: What animated movie features a lovable snowman named Olaf?
items.explanation: The 2013 Disney film became a massive worldwide sensation.
